title: Billie Lourd and her father Bryan are firing back on unauthorized biography on Carrie Fisher
text:
The daughter and ex-husband of the late great Carrie Fisher are disavowing an upcoming unauthorized biography about the Star Wars icon.

Bryan Lourd, who was married to Fisher from 1991 to 1994, and is the father of Fisher's only child, Billie Lourd, released a statement to People.

The unauthorized biography, Carrie Fisher: A Life On the Edge, will be published on November 12, but Bryan and Billie make it clear they have no involvement.

Father and daughter: The daughter and ex-husband of the late great Carrie Fisher are disavowing an upcoming unauthorized biography about the Star Wars icon

Unauthorized: The unauthorized biography, Carrie Fisher: A Life On the Edge, will be published on November 12, but Bryan and Billie make it clear they have no involvement

'A person named Sheila Weller has taken it upon herself to sell and write an unauthorized biography based on my daughter’s mother, Carrie Fisher,' began the statement by Bryan Lourd, a partner at Creative Artists Agency (CAA).

'I do not know Ms. Weller. Billie does not know Ms. Weller. And, to my knowledge, Carrie did not know her. Ms. Weller sold this book on her own without our involvement,' he continued.

'For all the fans and friends of Carrie, I just thought it necessary that you know this information before you decided to purchase this book or consider what is being said in the upcoming press interviews Weller will do while trying to sell it,' he continued.

Statement: 'A person named Sheila Weller has taken it upon herself to sell and write an unauthorized biography based on my daughter’s mother, Carrie Fisher,' began the statement by Bryan Lourd, a partner at Creative Artists Agency (CAA)

'To be clear I haven’t read the book. The only books about Carrie Fisher worth reading are the ones Carrie wrote herself. She perfectly told us everything we needed to know,' he concluded.

Bryan Lourd's statement comes just three days after his daughter Billie released a statement on what would have been her mother's 63rd birthday, but it did not mention this upcoming book.

'Today would have been my Momby’s 63rd birthday. Not that I’m some kind of grief expert by any means, but on milestones (or whatever you want to call them) like this, I like to celebrate her by doing things that she loved to do,' she began on Instagram.

Bryan: 'To be clear I haven’t read the book. The only books about Carrie Fisher worth reading are the ones Carrie wrote herself. She perfectly told us everything we needed to know,' he concluded

'So here’s a little video of me singing one of her favorite songs (American girl by Tom petty) in one of her favorite places (her bathtub of course),' she added

'I’ll probably have a pint of vanilla Haggen Dazs and a Coca Cola for dinner. ❤️ (Full song on IGTV sorry you guys!!! I’m bad at technology!!!)' she concluded.

The author Weller had previously written Girls Like Us: Carole King, Joni Mitchell, Carly Simon -- And a Journey of a Generation and Raging Heart: The Intimate Story of the Tragic Marriage of O.J. and Nicole Brown Simpson.

Favorite: 'So here’s a little video of me singing one of her favorite songs (American girl by Tom petty) in one of her favorite places (her bathtub of course),' she added

The description reveals the book follows, 'Fisher’s acting career, from her debut in Shampoo, the hit movie that defined mid-1970s Hollywood, to her seizing of the plum female role in Star Wars, which catapulted her to instant fame.'

'We explore her long, complex relationship with Paul Simon and her relatively peaceful years with the talent agent Bryan Lourd.'

'We witness her startling leap―on the heels of a near-fatal overdose―from actress to highly praised, bestselling author, the Dorothy Parker of her place and time,' the description adds.

The book will be published November 12 through Sarah Crichton Books.
